segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
Today we're bringing you a lesson about the office, so something related to business, right?
segments.cn: 今天我们带来一节关于办公室的课程，和商业相关的，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
And in this lesson, we're learning language you can use to tell someone they did a good job.
segments.cn: 在这节课中，我们学习可以用来告诉某人他们做得好的语言。

segments.en: Okay, so a job well done.
You want to praise somebody.
That's right.
So we're going to listen in as a manager praises his employee on a presentation.
segments.cn: 所以我们将听一位经理赞美他的员工在演示中的表现。

segments.en: Okay, so before we listen to the dialogue, let's take a look very quickly at Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们听对话之前，快速看一下词汇预览。

segments.en: Well, we're going to hear both of these words in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们将在对话中听到这两个词。

segments.en: And the first one is a whiz.
Whiz.
To be a whiz.
Okay, so it's an adjective.
Somebody is a whiz.
That's right.
And whiz comes from the word wizard.
Okay, so kind of like a witch, but a guy-witch.
segments.cn: 好的，有点像女巫，但男巫。

segments.en: Yeah, man-witch.
So a whiz is someone who is really good at something.
segments.cn: 所以whiz是指在某方面非常优秀的人。

segments.en: Okay, so I can say David is a computer whiz.
segments.cn: 好的，我可以说David是个计算机whiz。

segments.en: Or Anthony is a math whiz.
Okay, so he's really good at computers or he's really good at math or he knows a lot about math.
segments.cn: 好的，他在计算机方面非常优秀，或者他在数学方面非常优秀，或者他对数学了解很多。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, and our second word.
Well, we're going to hear about slides.
Slides.
PowerPoint slides.
PowerPoint slides.
Okay, so everyone knows PowerPoint, right?
A computer program.
A computer program that you use to make presentations.
segments.cn: 用于制作演示文稿的计算机程序。

segments.en: And a slide is one page in that presentation.
segments.cn: 幻灯片是演示文稿中的一页。

segments.en: Okay, so if you have ten pages in your PowerPoint presentation, you basically have ten slides.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你的PowerPoint演示文稿有十页，你基本上就有十张幻灯片。

segments.en: Exactly.
Very good.
So now let's listen to the dialogue for the first time and we're going to see what's happening in this business meeting.
segments.cn: 现在让我们第一次听对话，看看这次商务会议发生了什么。

segments.en: And so that concludes my outline for our marketing strategy next year.
segments.cn: 这就是我对明年市场策略的概述。

segments.en: Thank you very much for your time.
Hey, that was quite the presentation.
segments.cn: 嘿，那真是一次精彩的演示。

segments.en: Honestly, I was completely blown away by your strategy outline.
segments.cn: 说实话，我对你的策略概述感到非常震惊。

segments.en: I've got to say, Alex, you really wowed me today.
segments.cn: 我得说，Alex，你今天真的让我惊艳。

segments.en: Ah, come on, it was nothing.
I'm just doing my job?
No, I think you deserve some recognition here.
segments.cn: 不，我认为你值得一些认可。

segments.en: I mean, if I look back on your previous presentations, this is a huge improvement.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，如果我回顾你之前的演示，这是一个巨大的进步。

segments.en: Well, Kristin did give me a hand with the slides.
segments.cn: 好吧，Kristin确实帮我处理了幻灯片。

segments.en: She's a real whiz on PowerPoint.
And I saw that you took on board my feedback about pricing strategies.
segments.cn: 我看到你采纳了我关于定价策略的反馈。

segments.en: I really appreciate you taking the time to think through my suggestions.
segments.cn: 我非常感谢你花时间考虑我的建议。

segments.en: Yeah, well, that was some good advice.
segments.cn: 是的，那是一些很好的建议。

segments.en: You made some really good points.
segments.cn: 你提出了一些非常好的观点。

segments.en: Well, I just wanted to say well done.
Really, you did a great job.
All right, well, it sounds like the employee is a little bit shy or embarrassed by receiving all of these compliments.
segments.cn: 好吧，听起来这位员工对收到这么多赞美有点害羞或尴尬。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess he's kind of being humble about it.
Exactly.
So why don't we move on to the language now.
segments.cn: 那么我们现在为什么不继续学习语言呢。

segments.en: There are so many really useful phrases in this dialogue, that I think we're just going to focus on those today.
segments.cn: 这个对话中有很多非常有用的短语，我想今天我们就专注于这些。

segments.en: So let's get started with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以让我们开始流利表达。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
Okay, so today on Fluency Builder, let's start with our first phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在流利表达中，让我们从第一个短语开始。

segments.en: The boss was so impressed with the presentation that he said, I was completely blown away.
segments.cn: 老板对演示印象深刻，说我完全被震撼了。

segments.en: To be completely blown away.
Okay, so to be completely blown away.
Or to be blown away.
All right, so what does that mean to be blown away?
segments.cn: 好的，被震撼是什么意思？

segments.en: To be surprised and amazed, but in a very positive way.
segments.cn: 被惊讶和惊艳，但以非常积极的方式。

segments.en: Okay, so I can say, I'm surprised, I'm amazed, but I'm still not very clear on this.
segments.cn: 好的，我可以说，我很惊讶，我很惊艳，但我仍然不太清楚。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to a couple of examples of how we could use this phrase.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听几个例子，看看我们如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: Example one.
Carl blew me away with his knowledge of political science.
segments.cn: Carl用他的政治科学知识让我震撼。

segments.en: Example two.
I was blown away when I heard that Jenny and Rick had gotten married.
segments.cn: 当我听说Jenny和Rick结婚时，我感到震撼。

segments.en: They had known each other for less than a month.
Example three.
My parents were blown away when they found out I had a tattoo.
segments.cn: 当我的父母发现我有纹身时，他们感到震撼。

segments.en: Okay, so I think that's a little bit clearer now.
segments.cn: 好的，我想现在清楚多了。

segments.en: And this is a wonderful way to give your praise to someone when they do something really amazing.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的方式来赞美某人，当他们做了非常了不起的事情。

segments.en: Okay, so completely blown away.
You blew me away.
That's right.
Now what about our second word?
Well, it's quite similar.
The boss said that you really wowed me.
segments.cn: 老板说你真的让我惊艳。

segments.en: You wowed me.
To wow someone.
Okay, so it's spelled W-O-W.
Wow.
So when you wow someone, you make that person go wow.
segments.cn: 所以当你让某人惊艳时，你让那个人感到wow。

segments.en: Okay, so you impress somebody.
segments.cn: 好的，你给某人留下深刻印象。

segments.en: Yep.
To wow someone.
I can use it as a verb.
You wowed me.
I want to wow you.
Well, I want you to wow me.
segments.cn: 好吧，我希望你让我惊艳。

segments.en: Okay, so wow.
Now let's take a look at our third phrase.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看我们的第三个短语。

segments.en: The guy, he's a little bit shy.
He's trying to be a little bit humble about, you know, receiving so many compliments.
segments.cn: 他试图对收到这么多赞美表现得谦虚一点。

segments.en: So he says, oh it was nothing.
It was nothing.
Really, it was nothing.
It was nothing.
So that's a way of saying it wasn't hard or it's not a big deal.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种说法，表示这并不难或这没什么大不了。

segments.en: It's not that important.
Exactly.
So if somebody's saying, wow, thank you so much for lending me your car.
segments.cn: 所以如果有人说，哇，非常感谢你借我车。

segments.en: It was nothing.
All right.
It's a polite way actually to respond to a nice compliment.
segments.cn: 这实际上是一种礼貌的回应方式。

segments.en: Very good.
So before we move on to our next phrase, let's listen to a couple of examples with it was nothing.
segments.cn: 在我们继续下一个短语之前，让我们听几个关于“没什么”的例子。

segments.en: Example one.
Thanks for lending me your car this week.
I really appreciate it.
It's okay, really.
It was nothing.
Example two.
I can't believe you organized the surprise birthday party.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信你组织了惊喜生日派对。

segments.en: Thank you so much.
Don't worry about it.
It was nothing.
Okay, so I think that's pretty clear.
Now our final phrase here for Fluency Builder, the employee said that Kirsten gave him a hand.
segments.cn: 现在我们最后一个短语是流利构建器，员工说Kirsten帮了他。

segments.en: Okay, so to give someone a hand.
Give me a hand.
Give me a hand.
Basically to help someone.
Help me or assist me.
Okay, so to help someone, give me a hand or let me give you a hand.
segments.cn: 好的，帮助某人，给我一个忙或让我帮你一个忙。

segments.en: That's right.
All right.
Very good.
So great phrases in Fluency Builder today.
segments.cn: 今天流利构建器中的短语很棒。

segments.en: I think it's time for us to listen to the dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 我想是时候让我们第二次听对话了。

segments.en: We're going to slow it down a little bit so we can catch all these phrases, and then we'll come back.
segments.cn: 我们会稍微放慢速度，以便能听到所有这些短语，然后我们会回来。

segments.en: And so that concludes my outline for our marketing strategy for next year.
segments.cn: 所以这就结束了我对明年市场策略的概述。

segments.en: Thank you very much for your time.
Hey, that was quite the presentation.
segments.cn: 嘿，那真是个精彩的演示。

segments.en: Honestly, I was completely blown away by your strategy outline.
segments.cn: 说实话，我完全被你的策略概述震撼了。

segments.en: I've got to say, Alex, you really wowed me today.
segments.cn: 我得说，Alex，今天你真的让我惊艳。

segments.en: Ah, come on.
It was nothing.
I'm just doing my job.
No, I think you deserve some recognition here.
segments.cn: 不，我认为你值得一些认可。

segments.en: I mean, if I look back on your previous presentations, this is a huge improvement.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，如果我回顾你之前的演示，这次是一个巨大的进步。

segments.en: Well, Kristen did give me a hand with the slides.
segments.cn: 嗯，Kristen确实帮我做了幻灯片。

segments.en: She's a real whiz on PowerPoint.
And I saw that you took on board my feedback about pricing strategies.
segments.cn: 我看到你采纳了我关于定价策略的反馈。

segments.en: I really appreciate you taking the time to think through my suggestions.
segments.cn: 我真的很感激你花时间考虑我的建议。

segments.en: Yeah, well, that was some good advice.
segments.cn: 是的，那是一些很好的建议。

segments.en: You made some really good points.
segments.cn: 你提出了一些非常好的观点。

segments.en: Well, I just wanted to say well done.
Really, you did a great job.
Okay, so like we said before, there's a lot of really helpful phrases in here.
segments.cn: 好的，正如我们之前所说，这里有很多非常有用的短语。

segments.en: And we're going to look at a few more of these in putting it together.
segments.cn: 我们将再看看其中一些短语，进行整合。

segments.en: Putting it together.
Okay, so let's start with the first phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，我们先从第一个短语开始。

segments.en: The boss was quite impressed with him.
And he said, that was quite the presentation.
segments.cn: 他说，那真是个精彩的演示。

segments.en: That was quite the presentation.
All right, quite the presentation.
segments.cn: 好吧，真是个精彩的演示。

segments.en: So this phrase, quite the presentation, it means it was good, right?
segments.cn: 所以这个短语，真是个精彩的演示，意味着这很好，对吧？

segments.en: It was it was special.
It was it was very good.
Yep.
Now we can take the noun presentation out and replace it with any other noun.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以把名词演示替换成任何其他名词。

segments.en: All right, so I can say, Bob is quite the basketball player.
segments.cn: 好的，我可以说，Bob真是个篮球运动员。

segments.en: Why don't we listen now for a few more examples.
segments.cn: 为什么我们现在不听几个例子呢。

segments.en: Example one.
I heard you are quite the dancer.
Can you teach me some moves?
Example two.
Carl is quite the ladies man.
He is very good when it comes to talking to girls.
segments.cn: 他在和女孩交谈时非常出色。

segments.en: Example three.
Nancy is quite gifted at math.
segments.cn: Nancy在数学方面非常有天赋。

segments.en: She can solve any math problem you give her.
segments.cn: 她能解决你给她的任何数学问题。

segments.en: So you're saying in a in a very good way that something is very good or special.
segments.cn: 所以你是在以非常好的方式说某事非常好或特别。

segments.en: All right.
So the boss was very impressed with the employee and he said, and I saw that you took on board my feedback to take on board my feedback.
segments.cn: 所以老板对员工印象深刻，他说，我看到你采纳了我的反馈。

segments.en: OK, so take on board something.
So here my feedback is my suggestions, right?
segments.cn: 所以这里我的反馈是我的建议，对吧？

segments.en: And when you take on board my feedback, you accept my feedback and you use it.
segments.cn: 当你采纳我的反馈时，你接受我的反馈并使用它。

segments.en: OK, so I can say, for example, I want you to take on board my ideas.
segments.cn: 好的，我可以说，例如，我希望你采纳我的想法。

segments.en: Or Jenny took on board a few of my suggestions.
segments.cn: 或者Jenny采纳了我的一些建议。

segments.en: I was really happy.
OK, very good.
So to take on board, to accept and use.
All right.
So take on board feedback, take on board suggestion, take on board ideas.
segments.cn: 所以采纳反馈，采纳建议，采纳想法。

segments.en: OK, very good.
And we have one more phrase.
I'm putting it together today to think something through.
segments.cn: 我今天在整合，思考某事。

segments.en: To think it through.
OK, so think it through.
So here the boss said that he took the time to think through my suggestions.
segments.cn: 所以这里老板说他花时间考虑了我的建议。

segments.en: So think through.
What does that mean?
To think carefully about all of the details of something.
segments.cn: 仔细考虑某事的所有细节。

segments.en: OK, so to take into consideration all the aspects.
segments.cn: 好的，所以考虑所有方面。

segments.en: Right.
So why don't we give an example?
segments.cn: 那我们为什么不举个例子呢？

segments.en: If you're thinking through a plan, right?
segments.cn: 如果你在考虑一个计划，对吧？

segments.en: You don't just think about the end, the outcome.
You want to think about all of the small details, the steps in that plan.
segments.cn: 你想考虑计划中的所有小细节和步骤。

segments.en: OK, so maybe I want to buy a new car, but it's a lot of money.
segments.cn: 好的，也许我想买一辆新车，但这需要很多钱。

segments.en: So I really have to think it through.
segments.cn: 所以我真的得深入思考。

segments.en: So you have to think carefully about everything that is involved in buying the new car, all the money you're going to have to, you know, not spend on parties.
segments.cn: 所以你必须仔细考虑购买新车所涉及的一切，所有你将不得不，嗯，不花在聚会上的钱。

segments.en: And exactly.
You have to think it through.
You have to analyze it very carefully.
segments.cn: 你必须非常仔细地分析。

segments.en: That's right.
So let's give a few examples of how we can use this phrase.
segments.cn: 那我们来举几个例子，看看如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: Hey, Marco, have you thought through my suggestions?
segments.cn: 嘿，Marco，你考虑过我的建议吗？

segments.en: I can say you guys are very young.
I think you should think it through before you get married.
segments.cn: 我觉得你们在结婚前应该深入思考。

segments.en: Good advice.
OK, so to think it through.
OK, so three great phrases.
And why don't we hear them one more time in our dialogue?
segments.cn: 我们再在对话中听一遍吧？

segments.en: And so that concludes my outline for our marketing strategy next year.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我对明年市场策略的概述。

segments.en: Thank you very much for your time.
Hey, that was quite the presentation.
segments.cn: 嘿，那真是个精彩的演示。

segments.en: Honestly, I was completely blown away by your strategy outline.
segments.cn: 说实话，我对你的策略概述感到非常震惊。

segments.en: I've got to say, Alex, you really wowed me today.
segments.cn: 我得说，Alex，今天你真的让我刮目相看。

segments.en: Come on.
It was nothing.
I'm just doing my job.
No, I think you deserve some recognition here.
segments.cn: 不，我认为你值得一些认可。

segments.en: I mean, if I look back on your previous presentations, this is a huge improvement.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，如果我回顾你之前的演示，这次是一个巨大的进步。

segments.en: Well, Kristen did give me a hand with the slides.
segments.cn: 嗯，Kristen确实帮我做了幻灯片。

segments.en: She's a real whiz on PowerPoint.
And I saw that you took on board my feedback about pricing strategies.
segments.cn: 我看到你考虑了我关于定价策略的反馈。

segments.en: I really appreciate you taking the time to think through my suggestions.
segments.cn: 我真的很感激你花时间深入思考我的建议。

segments.en: Yeah, well, that was some good advice.
segments.cn: 是的，那确实是个好建议。

segments.en: You made some really good points.
segments.cn: 你提出了一些非常好的观点。

segments.en: Well, I just wanted to say, well done.
Really, you did a great job.
OK, great dialogue and some interesting phrases for giving praise.
segments.cn: 好的，很好的对话和一些有趣的赞美短语。

segments.en: Right.
That's, I think, very important in the workplace.
segments.cn: 我认为这在职场中非常重要。

segments.en: Yeah.
And, you know, I read recently that something like six out of every 10 employees don't get regular praise from their boss.
segments.cn: 而且，你知道，我最近读到大约六成员工没有定期得到老板的赞美。

segments.en: Yeah, it's very important.
And in some cultures, well, it's not very common to praise or to give positive feedback to their employees.
segments.cn: 在某些文化中，赞美或给予员工积极反馈并不常见。

segments.en: Yeah, but I think for Western employees, actually, it's really important and it helps them work harder the more the more times they hear job well done.
segments.cn: 是的，但我认为对于西方员工来说，这真的很重要，听到“做得好”会让他们更努力工作。

segments.en: Yeah, very good.
So now you have the tools that maybe you can use with your employees or with your friends, with your friends.
segments.cn: 所以现在你有了可以用来对你的员工或朋友的工具。

segments.en: Yep.
OK, so if you have any questions, comments or doubts, please come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你有任何问题、评论或疑虑，请访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Yeah, Marco and I are always around to help you out.
segments.cn: 是的，Marco和我随时乐意帮助你。

segments.en: So until next time, thanks for listening and goodbye.
segments.cn: 所以下次再见，感谢你的收听，再见。

segments.en: Bye.
